content: For the past 2 weeks ever time I watch the news I have to watch people filling millions of sand bags to protect their homes from being flooded by the Red River in North Dakota. Yesterday while watching TV I heard a man say while being interviewed, " This is it. I've had enough of this. Every year I've had to go through this for the past 15 years. I've had it" Well I understand that a persons home is their castle and they were brought up in that neck of the woods but come on! After one or two floods that would do it for me. I'd find a hill somewhere.

content: quote: Why do people love hardship? ... for affliction is a treasure, and scarce any man hath enough of it. No man hath affliction enough that is not matured and ripened by it, and made fit for God by that affliction. Tribulation is treasure in the nature of it, but it is not current money in the use of it, except we get nearer and nearer our home, Heaven, by it. Another man may be sick too, and sick to death, and this affliction may lie in his bowels, as gold in a mine, and be of no use to him; but this bell, that tells me of his affliction, digs out and applies that gold to me: if by this consideration of another's danger (affliction) I take mine own into contemplation, and so secure myself, by making my recourse to my God, who is our only security. (Ask not for whom the bell tolls; it tolls for thee. John Donne) Wandering and Wondering
